project.name: |-- 001-list-before-generics
project.description:
Keywords: + Generics + Diamond Language
This project includes a very simple example involving a class with and without generics.
ListWithoutGenerics: Demonstrates how a List without generics needs a cast to the right type of object each time you retrieve an item from the List, and what's worst lets you add any kind of object to the List (e.g. Strings and Integers). Then, the same example is done with a generic List.
The class includes a simple runner that can be executed as java programs.
